<Text: The Kinoks ("kino-oki," meaning cinema-eyes) were a collective of Soviet filmmakers in 1920s Russia, based most notably around film editor Dziga Vertov (pseudonym Denis Kaufman).
Triplets:<The Kinoks
1:
--------------------
Text: Kinoks:  In 1919 Vertov and his future wife, the talented film editor Elizaveta Svilova, plus several other young filmmakers created a group called Kinoks ("kino-oki," meaning cinema-eyes).
Triplets:<Vertov
2:
--------------------
<Text: Kinoks:  In 1922 they were joined by Mikhail Kaufman, who had just returned from the civil war.>
